benchmark_details.name: Dialogue Summarization with LLMs: Circumstantial Inference Trends
benchmark_details.overview: This benchmark evaluates the faithfulness of LLMs (GPT-4 and Alpaca-13B) in dialogue summarization, focusing on identifying and categorizing circumstantial inconsistencies.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To benchmark the effectiveness of large language models in dialogue summarization and identify specific types of errors resulting from their generation.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Limited to two LLMs, which may not represent all LLM behaviors.

data.annotation: Human annotations identifying inconsistent spans based on dialogue summaries.

methodology.calculation: Comparison of human annotations against model-generated summaries to identify inconsistencies.
methodology.interpretation: LLMs exhibit unique error patterns compared to fine-tuned models, particularly with circumstantial inferences.
methodology.baseline_results: 23% inconsistency in GPT-4 summaries, 38% errors classified as circumstantial inference.
methodology.validation: Inter-annotator agreement was 66.94% using F-1 metric.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential introduction of misinformation through circumstantial inferences.
